repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Integrated Community
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Integrated Community
            Development Project for West Bank and Gaza were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was high, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            in such contexts, relevant capacity building and training
            initiatives tend to get sidelined if they are not built into
            the project works execution and therefore require special
            attention in design, finance and implementation. The
            addition of the telecenters component, though innovative,
            was arguably a stretch for Palestinian Economic Council for
            Development and Reconstruction (PECDAR) with its focus on
            engineering. The development of the telecenters required a
            different kind of specialize and was taxing on PECDAR's
            staff and supervision time. Lack of donor participation in
            funding or other collaboration should be cause for concern.
            It is understood with the onset of the intifada (Palestinian
            uprising), many donors retreated to emergency aid. However,
            with a proliferation of donors, some continuing to work in
            community development, there should be more assertive
            efforts to drive a common framework. The role of the
            community development consultant (CDC) should be reinforced
            in project preparation, with buy-in from all stakeholders,
            and the position active up-front and throughout the project.

docna.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Integrated Community
            Development Project

repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Integrated Community
            Development Project : additional financing

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed additional grant finance to
            the Integrated Community Development Project (ICDP) for West
            Bank and Gaza will increase investments in local
            infrastructure and institutions to improve the quality and
            availability of basic social and economic services in poor
            and marginalized communities of West Bank and Gaza promoting
            local economic growth and employment, and supporting human
            development and poverty reduction. Additional financing will
            support micro projects such as access and connecting roads,
            rehabilitation or extension of water supply, schools, sport
            and cultural facilities for young people, and health
            clinics. Priority will be given to projects with the highest
            labor content (labor content to be more than 30 percent) and
            which reach the most communities.

repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Integrated Community
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Integrated Community Development
            Project aims at improving the quality, and availability of
            basic social, and economic services in poor, and marginal
            communities in the West Bank and Gaza. Project components
            include: 1) financing of community development
            micro-projects, providing grants to local government units
            (LGUs), and farmer cooperatives. These micro-projects will
            be prepared by local officials in consultation with
            residents, and implemented in accordance with project
            procedures, i.e., using local contractors, suppliers, and
            laborers. Each micro-project will include civil works for
            construction, extension or rehabilitation of water supply,
            sanitation, solid waste management, health clinics,
            additions to primary and secondary schools, as well as
            community markets, feeder roads, irrigation networks, and
            essential furniture and goods. Resources will be available
            for training and technical services to improve planning,
            consultation, and management capacity of communities; 2)
            financing of multipurpose, community tele-centers, through
            grants provided to LGUs, so as to extend, or reconfigure
            facilities to accommodate information and communication
            technologies (ICT) infrastructure, provide computers,
            software, furniture and equipment, and set Internet
            services, supported by specialized services; and, 3) project
            management costs, to finance incremental operating costs,
            equipment, and studies.

repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Integrated Community
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Integrated Community Development
            Project will finance investments in infrastructure
            rehabilitation, and reconstruction, aiming at improving its
            operational, and maintenance systems, so as to provide basic
            social, and economic infrastructure services in marginal
            areas of the West Bank and Gaza. Although the project is
            expected to improve pollution levels, and thus improve
            public health risks, this environmental assessment looks at
            potential adverse effects on the environment as a result of
            project implementation. Mitigation is as follows. During
            construction activities will be limited to a daytime
            schedule, to reduce noise disturbances; traffic signs will
            be installed to divert traffic as needed; and, speed will be
            reduced to prevent excessive congestion. During the design
            stage, proposals will be included to reduce storm water
            runoff, and potential wastewater contamination, by
            intercepting runoff through perforated infiltration pits
            along the road, diverting part of the runoff to tributary
            sandy roads. Bond evacuation, and cleaning will be performed
            during the rainy season. During construction, special care
            will be taken to avoid water breaks on pipes, or house
            connections, and, a survey of existing facilities prior to
            construction, should monitor excavation works, while
            provisions for immediate repair should an emergency occur,
            will be established. An appropriate water tariff structure
            will be implemented, followed by an awareness campaign to
            educate the population on water consumption issues, and
            conservation aspects as well.
